commit_message:
Save previous template on non-convergence updates

We already store the previous template for convergence based
updates, but for non-convergence updates we can reuse the same
column to enable recovery from a failed update when using
PATCH updates, e.g where the error is in the environment or
nested templates and thus the top-level template may not be
provided & it's valid to use the previously stored one.

Change-Id: I79248bedb01260a0c4b1edf183db55fc0bffbdf6

fixup

Change-Id: I1e9ee3548ceeeaf882a95ec9fed50be320a9859d

commit_message:
Adds the config_template to OpenStack Services

The change modifies the ceilometer template tasks such that its now
using the config_template action plugin. This change will make so that
OpenStack services can be dynamically updated, for any of its config
files, by a deployer, at run time, without requiring the need to modify
the in tree templates or defaults.

Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

Change-Id: Ia88064e2bf870e1bf7659408b84e8ac1be46b803

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-27 23:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['.eslintrc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/eslint-config-openstack/commit/502b448977c6c95a44f8dee00f7d65401809f044', 'message': "Enabled no-new

The goal of using new with a constructor is typically to create an
object of a particular type and store that object in a variable, such
as:

  var person = new Person();

It's less common to use new and not store the result, such as:

  new Person();

In this case, the created object is thrown away because its
reference isn't stored anywhere, and in many cases, this means that
the constructor should be replaced with a function that doesn't
require new to be used.

Change-Id: I2afcd3014aa1c1ea05146ba539efd18704a46d2c
"}]
commit_message:
Enabled no-new

The goal of using new with a constructor is typically to create an
object of a particular type and store that object in a variable, such
as:

  var person = new Person();

It's less common to use new and not store the result, such as:

  new Person();

In this case, the created object is thrown away because its
reference isn't stored anywhere, and in many cases, this means that
the constructor should be replaced with a function that doesn't
require new to be used.

Change-Id: I2afcd3014aa1c1ea05146ba539efd18704a46d2c

commit_message:
Fixes CLI client called without subcommands

If CLI client is called without any subcommands or arguments it will
fail with """'Namespace' object has no attribute 'command'""". This
is coming from the getattr which does not have alternate value
specified.

Closes-Bug: #1494259

Change-Id: I461f0d4a91f3af2224bafc14a88572a8e4a3c051

commit_message:
Enable specs sphinx build

Currently Congress specs sphinx doc build broken,
all of the rst files can't be built into html files,
so previewing the html format of specs is impossible.
Fix it so that we can review specs in human readable way.

Some format issues exist in current rst files, so fix these
at the same time so that tox py27 and docs build can pass.

Change-Id: I0dcdfb315e8314fb54d7333c2395d41ff6a0c9a6

commit_message:
Don't return 300 when requesting /versions

Whenever the versions resource is used, it'll reply with a 300 status
code. This is the desired behavior when requesting versions that we
don't support and/or non-existent.

However, when the user requests specifically for the `/versions`
endpoint, Glance shouldn't reply with a 300 since there's just 1 choice
for such endpoint.

APIImpact
Closes-bug: #1491350

Change-Id: I23e3780e5d1b609753ffef59418115f45ab45fe7

commit_message:
List creation could be rewritten as a list literal

In _out method of sqlalchemy/artifacts.py module,
list "deparr' is created as below.

deparr = []
deparr.append(_out(dep.dest, new_show_level))

Could be rewritten as

deparr = [_out(dep.dest, new_show_level)]

Closes-Bug: 1482588
Change-Id: I44ff4683d06a4593e2f2528d6f193c656657206c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/07/210307/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Initial msync run for all Puppet OpenStack modules

This patch is the initial modulesync run, it impacts:

* gitignore: just a sync between projects
* gemfile:
  - update and allow to setup facter version and gem source
  - split beaker gems with a dedicated group
  - switch to rspec-puppet 2.2.0
* rakefile:
  - use the new syntax for lint configuration
  - add a acceptance target
* acceptance:
  - sync nodesets
  - update tests in order to use zuul-cloner
* spec: added rspec coverage report

Change-Id: Iadefbe2cc0525224e9917c6712712c67ce1e0fff

commit_message:
Disable lint warning check

This variable is cast to a string to avoid validate_re() breaking, but
puppet-lint gives a warning for a string containing only a variable.
This disables the warning for this line only.

Change-Id: I8faadf0194b61fd9fc709c7287f46b003b92e7e4

commit_message:
Enabling log compression by default

Most of the logs are compressed already based on configurations in
/etc/logrotate.d, but this patch ensures that the remaining logs are
compressed during the rotation process.

Closes-Bug: 1493981

Change-Id: If11c6d3a292b3621c00a8d0b775274a8096eaa66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/24/221924/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
acceptance/eventlet: make sure apache is stopped

When testing upgrades, we have some cases where we apply the wsgi
manifest first and then eventlet. The problem is apache which is
started so ceilo-api cannot be started because ports are already in use.

So this patch installs Apache on eventlet manifest and makes sure
the service is stopped before trying to start ceilo-api with eventlet.

Change-Id: I4aae37fcbf60e61c0eb8385dedc950674661b592
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/38/216038/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # make sure apache is stopped before ceilometer-api eventlet # in case of wsgi was run before class { '::apache': service_ensure => 'stopped', } Service['httpd'] -> Service['keystone']

commit_message:
Add a PROJECT_VENV_ARGS array

Individual projects may wish to declare different settings for their
virtualenvs. PROJECT_VENV_ARGS provides a straightforward way to do
so. Primarily this can be used to choose --system-site-packages, but
there may be situations where a different python version is desired
for the virtualenv.

Change-Id: Ia3e98194e7411555bf420ee08a986d6006b5d913
Closes-Bug: #1491297
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/28/219628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: VENV_ARGS=${1:-""} shiftvirtualenv $VENV_ARGS $VENV_DEST

commit_message:
Release python-novaclient 2.29

Various fixes relating to being defensive when people use the client in
unexpected ways, including defaulting v2.Client to v2.0 API version.

Given the addition of a deprecation warning, I have incremented the
minor version.

There was also a bug fix to help with bdm code sending incorrect
requests, causing a 400 error when using API v2.1

Change-Id: I0848e7328cf62ea0872e9e9473d823735f65f16a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/60/222560/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - version: 2.29 projects: - repo: openstack/python-novaclient hash: 31d4e026b447bfac43fa943176b353fcfd2800d8 highlights: > Deprecate novaclient.client.get_client_class and default v2.Client to use v2.0 when no version is given.

commit_message:
Keep the instance_type meta from polling and notification consistent

The metadata.instance_type from polling is set to flavor id, but from
notifications, it is set to flavor name.

Change-Id: I4f260e5c7e29fa7bf890930abc8be4ec5b611554
Closes-Bug: 1489132
(cherry picked from commit 4dfce21e07052ac9518fa169bd6d4ca80e9373ef)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/97/218697/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: instance_type = instance.flavor['name'] if instance.flavor else None 'instance_type': instance_type,

commit_message:
neutronclient: unbreak create/update

The class inheritance was wrong, resulting in
the empty args2body method from extension.ClientExtensionXXX to
override the more useful one we define in BGPVPNCreateUpdateCommonMixin.

Change-Id: I3779571e97d3c2a9bf274b6de0dc56596786e750

commit_message:
Used named veth pairs that match container

The default veth names from LXC make it difficult to tell which veth
corresponds to each container.  This patch sets a unique veth name
that matches the container as well as the network device inside the
container.  It should make troubleshooting a little easier.

Oddly enough, this patch seems to fix or greatly reduce the occurence
of the issues seen in ticket 1491440.

Partial-Bug: 1491440
Implements: blueprint named-veths
Change-Id: I28553fd1b4f36991e11d55d56c3f0f46af9e52be
(cherry picked from commit 5e6dea8ab6f408e6610c34220519b628e8f8c45c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/95/222295/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix Ceilometer datasource errors on poll

The data structure of Ceilometer event.traits object had
been changed, that cause Ceilometer datasource driver errors
on poll. Update the related translator to adapt it, change
event.traits translator from VDICT to in-list HDICT on
Ceilometer driver.

UpgradeImpact: the schema of Ceilometer event had been adjusted,
need to update related persistent rules when upgrade to this release.

Change-Id: I05c095c5cfb5cbdf9a8f6b379450bf4a700e7fd3
Closes-Bug: #1492306
(cherry picked from commit 6d1667113f67730461260015837f7b3a849bc5ef)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/44/222244/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fixed some types in Congress tutorial

1) cirros image version is 0.3.4 now. So updated 0.3.2 to 0.3.4.
2) When requesting to congress by curl, <classification-id> is
   not correct. Default policy name 'classification' is correct.
3) Fixed the response of 18)

Change-Id: Ie461d93470d5c25f52aed3038ff2d606b376b0b0

commit_message:
[Sahara] Adding ability to update missing fields

Field is_proxy_gateway and use_autoconfig of template objects
didn't change its value after node group template edit.
This patch allows to use initial value of these fields.

Closes-bug: #1480301

Change-Id: I5ff98b2bda87c6ff24bbf6baed3aff7cb2c9af84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/93/207893/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: g_fields["proxygateway"].initial = self.template.is_proxy_gateway

commit_message:
[RN 7.0] Adds a Horizon resolved issue

This patch adds a Horizon resolved bug description to the
Mirantis OpenStack Components Resolved and Known Issues section of
Release Notes 7.0 page.

Related-Bug: #1468744

Change-Id: I3d5df870e1ed49ab0da1ebd72a6885b9796c6430
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/31/221031/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _horizon-mos: OpenStack Dashboard (Horizon) ----------------------------- Resolved issues +++++++++++++++ * An authenticated user may conduct a persistent XSS attack by setting a malicious metadata to a Glance image, a Nova flavor, or a Host Aggregate, and by tricking an administrator to load the update metadata page. Once executed in a legitimate context, this attack may result in a privilege escalation. To fix this, the metadata is escaped and then is interpreted as JSON. See `LP1468744`_. .. _`LP1468744`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1468744

commit_message:
xenapi: Support extra tgz images that with only a single VHD

Currently tgz images are supported only when the names of VHD files
within follow the format of "0.vhd, 1.vhd, ... (n-1).vhd" called VDI
chain.

To maximize the range of support, the arbitrary named VHD file could be
renamed to 0.vhd when the tgz image only has a single VHD file.

Change-Id: I01cadf26262b20f1ad5a19e4441b42a0155f5a52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/31/205831/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #Rename any format of name to 0.vhd when there is only single one contents = os.listdir(staging_path) if len(contents) == 1: filename = contents[0] if filename != '0.vhd' and filename[-4:] == '.vhd': _rename(os.path.join(staging_path, filename), \ os.path.join(staging_path, '0.vhd'))

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Adds RDPConsoleOps unit tests

The Hyper-V driver oldest tests (test_hypervapi.py) are proving hard to
maintain.

The tests in test_hypervapi.py in particular can also be refactored and
split in separate TestCases, one of each *ops module.

Adds RDPConsoleOps unit tests.
Removes test_hypervapi, as it does not contain any tests anymore.

This is the final commit, it removes the rest of test_hypervapi, its
fakes and stubs.

Change-Id: I8b583875438aac6082be75553942c7fe0b9dfbd7

commit_message:
Remove/deprecate unused parts of the compute node object

This change remove unused parts of the compute node object related to
its old connection with the service object. Unused remotable methods
that can't be removed until the next major version bump are left with
comments to do so when that happens.

Change-Id: Ia4bfd370a31c5b9286676b1f9440eeb420a60bec

commit_message:
Config resources applied after config template

When swift_*_config resources are applied before the respective config
file, the resources are overwritten

Set swift_${type}_config resources to be collected after
Concat['/etc/swift/${type}-server.conf']

types = {account,container,object,proxy}

Change-Id: I8072c7c5e1780ba8b0d9a3553aae6ee52f5c7de1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/43/205243/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: case $type { "object": { Concat["/etc/swift/${config_file_path}"] -> Swift_object_config <||> } "container": { Concat["/etc/swift/${config_file_path}"] -> Swift_container_config <||> } "account": { Concat["/etc/swift/${config_file_path}"] -> Swift_account_config <||> } }

commit_message:
Object: Fix KeyError when loading instance from db

When migrate to latest version object, if there are old db instance objects,
nova object will be failed to load them from db and cause internal errors.

This patch use get to avoid KeyError.

Closes-Bug: #1478430
Change-Id: I30ddab33ebff14e695e7f2450eb5083544f9ba63

commit_message:
Creation of designate::db::sync

In order to standardize the way dbsync are run across our modules,
we create a new class designate::db::sync and
designate::db::powerdns::sync.
Those classes will be included if sync_db is enabled.

By making this transition the designate::db::sync class and the powerdns
related one can be returned by the ENC.

A use case would be in an highly available environment, with 3 galera
nodes, include designate::db on every node with sync_db set to false
and have the ENC return designate::db::sync just for one node.

Change-Id: I3e14b82055cfadf3274d6657413668b11f28ec49

commit_message:
Fix ScaleIO commands in rootwrap filters

Currently the ScaleIO command entry in compute.filters is this:
drv_cfg: CommandFilter, /opt/emc/scaleio/sdc/bin/drv_cfg, --query_guid,
root

During CI testing, we found that it should be changed to the following:
drv_cfg: CommandFilter, /opt/emc/scaleio/sdc/bin/drv_cfg, root,
/opt/emc/scaleio/sdc/bin/drv_cfg, --query_guid

Change-Id: I0ee874feb1fe2dd47694f81cb532f2e0fe3170cb
Closes-Bug: #1494467
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/46/222346/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: drv_cfg: CommandFilter, /opt/emc/scaleio/sdc/bin/drv_cfg, root, /opt/emc/scaleio/sdc/bin/drv_cfg, --query_guid

subject: Set vif and allocated when associating fixed ip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 15:16:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/dd1e900ccf9c139023caf3fcd09e5cadf96c6082', 'message': 'Set vif and allocated when associating fixed ip

Follow on to changes I84fa2f0926f719bff33ac43b39e161a4eb412f44 and
I8cf5483982085da57ee470fa2753b0d0aebc12b3.

This change removes a race when associating fixed IPs and pools.
Originally, the fixed IPs were associated, and "allocated" and
"virtual_interface_id" were updated and saved to the DB at a later time.
These 2 values are now sent into associate(_pool) and are tunneled down
to the DB on associate, so now these 2 values are saved to the DB at
association.

Change-Id: Ic37d96deba3a5ef51594733cc16091173a9655a4
Closes-Bug: #1249065
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-05 18:13:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c919c8f72396297102027099d0723fd6dbe94b3b', 'message': 'Set vif and allocated when associating fixed ip

Follow on to changes I84fa2f0926f719bff33ac43b39e161a4eb412f44 and
I8cf5483982085da57ee470fa2753b0d0aebc12b3.

This change removes a race when associating fixed IPs and pools.
Originally, the fixed IPs were associated, and
"virtual_interface_id" was updated and saved to the DB at a later time.
This value is now sent into associate(_pool) and are tunneled down
to the DB on associate, so now the value saved to the DB at
association.

commit_message:
Set vif and allocated when associating fixed ip

Follow on to changes I84fa2f0926f719bff33ac43b39e161a4eb412f44 and
I8cf5483982085da57ee470fa2753b0d0aebc12b3.

This change removes a race when associating fixed IPs and pools.
Originally, the fixed IPs were associated, and
"virtual_interface_id" was updated and saved to the DB at a later time.
This value is now sent into associate(_pool) and are tunneled down
to the DB on associate, so now the value is saved to the DB at
association.

Change-Id: Ic37d96deba3a5ef51594733cc16091173a9655a4
Closes-Bug: #1249065

subject: Ensure cinder-backup-related variables are defined
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 11:14:06.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/ceph_client/tasks/ceph_auth.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/466de05c67fa4ea071909a20872c3876711a5c23', 'message': "Ensure cinder-backup-related variables are defined

This commit simply updates ceph_client/tasks/ceph_auth.yml to ensure
that cinder_service_backup_program_enabled and
cinder_service_backup_driver are defined before trying to evaluate
them.  On a normal deployment, this is not an issue but when running
os-nova-install.yml on an AIO where ceph support is enabled, this
variable evaluation fails as the AIO host is part of both cinder_backup
and nova_compute groups, but does not have access to these variable
defaults in os_cinder/defaults/main.yml since we're operating on the
os_nova role.

An alternate solution would be to add these variable defaults to
group_vars, however as the os_nova role doesn't actually need to use
them it's probably cleaner to just check if they're defined.

Change-Id: I2c35b14f42b2c452aa68a611ab68c612db1b07a4
Closes-Bug: #1493799
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure cinder-backup-related variables are defined

This commit simply updates ceph_client/tasks/ceph_auth.yml to ensure
that cinder_service_backup_program_enabled and
cinder_service_backup_driver are defined before trying to evaluate
them.  On a normal deployment, this is not an issue but when running
os-nova-install.yml on an AIO where ceph support is enabled, this
variable evaluation fails as the AIO host is part of both cinder_backup
and nova_compute groups, but does not have access to these variable
defaults in os_cinder/defaults/main.yml since we're operating on the
os_nova role.

An alternate solution would be to add these variable defaults to
group_vars, however as the os_nova role doesn't actually need to use
them it's probably cleaner to just check if they're defined.

Change-Id: I2c35b14f42b2c452aa68a611ab68c612db1b07a4
Closes-Bug: #1493799
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/05/221705/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: (item.0.component != 'cinder_backup' or ((cinder_service_backup_program_enabled is defined and cinder_service_backup_program_enabled | bool) and (cinder_service_backup_driver is defined and cinder_service_backup_driver == 'cinder.backup.drivers.ceph')))

subject: Configure dogtag installation's domain name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-23 12:44:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/f93b4e724e8c0f63ed6b8c45ffbb4a19ec98b430', 'message': "Configure dogtag installation's domain name

It seems that previously we were overriding the /etc/hosts in an
incorrect way. The gate had already several aliases for localhost which
we were completely discarding, and this might cause some issues with
some assumptions that were being taken in the gate.

On the other hand, a newer version of dogtag that is now being used in
the gate requires there to be a proper DNS domain name configured, and
this was causing the installation to fail in the gate.

So as a solution, we now force the fqdn to be localhost.localdomain. And
on the other hand, we explicitly configure dogtag to use localhost as a
hostname, since it was actually getting an alias from the hostname
command, which was not being found with the domain it was fetching from
the dnsdomainname command.

commit_message:
Configure dogtag installation's domain name

It seems that previously we were overriding the /etc/hosts in an
incorrect way. The gate had already several aliases for localhost which
we were completely discarding, and this might cause some issues with
some assumptions that were being taken in the gate.

On the other hand, a newer version of dogtag that is now being used in
the gate requires there to be a proper DNS domain name configured, and
this was causing the installation to fail in the gate.

So as a solution, we now force the fqdn to be localhost.localdomain. And
on the other hand, we explicitly configure dogtag to use localhost as a
hostname, since it was actually getting an alias from the hostname
command, which was not being found with the domain it was fetching from
the dnsdomainname command.

cherry-picked from: f8073466c4b3fd204e05cf8e9da7a956eadba406
Closes-Bug: #1477118
Change-Id: I7ea518ddc35ac96fb8594d57a1a46a32f30bf3c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/42/205042/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo sed -i 's/127.0.0.1[ \t]*localhost localhost.localdomain/127.0.0.1\tlocalhost.localdomain localhost/' /etc/hostspki_hostname=localhostpki_hostname=localhostpki_security_domain_hostname=localhost

cherry-picked from: 7b9dfa76ffa39f9e12657309e61a2e35a6b292bb

commit_message:
Use six.text_type instead of str in serialize_args

The EventReporter serializes any exception messages in
the event of a failure. If the message contains non-ascii
characters the string translation throws another exception
masking the original.

Change-Id: I13d277b803bcbcf010d42bbebe7eea61642be21a
Closes-Bug: #1493947
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/05/221905/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: kwargs[k] = six.text_type(v)

commit_message:
Adding HTML formatter

This patch adds the ability to output results in HTML format. It
currently doesn't support syntax highlighting due to fact that the Pygments
library is not in OpenStack's list of blessed requirements.

Change-Id: Ia9087a01856c1c743abba9fe4492130403b0f0d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/92/220592/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
from pygments import highlight from pygments.lexers import PythonLexer from pygments.formatters import HtmlFormatter def report_html(result_store, file_list, scores, excluded_files): '''Prints/returns warnings in HTML format :param result_store: results of scan as BanditResultStore object :param files_list: Which files were inspected :param scores: The scores awarded to each file in the scope :param excluded_files: Which files were excluded from the scope :return: A collection containing the HTML data ''' report_block = """ Bandit Report
{results}
""" if result_store.out_file is None: result_store.out_file = 'bandit_results.html' results = {} for key in result_store.resstore: file_issues = result_store.resstore[key] file_name = key issue_block = """

{test_text}

Severity: {severity}
Confidence: {confidence}
File: {path}
{code}
""" results[file_name] = [] for issue in file_issues: formatter = HtmlFormatter( linenos='table', linenostart=(min(issue['linerange']) - 1) ) code = result_store._get_code(issue, False) code = highlight(code, PythonLexer(), formatter) temp_result = issue_block.format( test_text=issue['issue_text'], severity=issue['issue_severity'], confidence=issue['issue_confidence'], path=file_name, code=code ) results[file_name].append(temp_result) with open(result_store.out_file, 'w') as fout: results_str = "" for res in results: if results[res]: for result in results[res]: results_str += result + "\n" report = report_block.format( style_css=HtmlFormatter().get_style_defs(), results=results_str ) fout.write(report) print("HTML output written to file: %s" % result_store.out_file)

Adds a new module ironic_python_agent.inspector and new entry point
for extensions, which will allow vendor-specific inspection.

Inspection is run on service start up just before the lookup.
Due to this early start, and due to the fact we don't even know
MAC address of nodes on inspection (to say nothing about IP addresses),
exception handling is a bit different from other agent features:
we try hard not to error out until we send at least something to inspector.

commit_message:
Add support for inspection using ironic-inspector

Adds a new module ironic_python_agent.inspector and new entry point
for extensions, which will allow vendor-specific inspection.

Inspection is run on service start up just before the lookup.
Due to this early start, and due to the fact we don't even know
MAC address of nodes on inspection (to say nothing about IP addresses),
exception handling is a bit different from other agent features:
we try hard not to error out until we send at least something to inspector.

Change-Id: I00932463d41819fd0a050782e2c88eddf6fc08c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/87/205587/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import logging import netifaces from ironic_python_agent.inspector import base LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def discover_basic_properties(data, args): # These properties might not be present, we don't count it as failure data['boot_interface'] = args.bootif data['ipmi_address'] = base.try_shell( "ipmitool lan print | grep -e 'IP Address [^S]' | awk '{ print $4 }'") LOG.info('BMC IP address: %s', data['ipmi_address']) def discover_network_interfaces(data, failures): data.setdefault('interfaces', {}) for iface in netifaces.interfaces(): if iface.startswith('lo'): LOG.info('ignoring local network interface %s', iface) continue LOG.debug('found network interface %s', iface) addrs = netifaces.ifaddresses(iface) try: mac = addrs[netifaces.AF_LINK][0]['addr'] except (KeyError, IndexError): LOG.info('no link information for interface %s in %s', iface, addrs) continue try: ip = addrs[netifaces.AF_INET][0]['addr'] except (KeyError, IndexError): LOG.info('no IP address for interface %s', iface) ip = None data['interfaces'][iface] = {'mac': mac, 'ip': ip} if data['interfaces']: LOG.info('network interfaces: %s', data['interfaces']) else: failures.add('no network interfaces found') def discover_scheduling_properties(data, failures): scripts = [ ('cpus', "grep processor /proc/cpuinfo | wc -l"), ('cpu_arch', "lscpu | grep Architecture | awk '{ print $2 }'"), ('local_gb', "fdisk -l | grep Disk | awk '{print $5}' | head -n 1"), ] for key, script in scripts: data[key] = base.try_shell(script) LOG.info('value for "%s" field is %s', key, data[key]) ram_info = base.try_shell( "dmidecode --type memory | grep Size | awk '{ print $2; }'") if ram_info: total_ram = 0 for ram_record in ram_info.split('\n'): try: total_ram += int(ram_record) except ValueError: pass data['memory_mb'] = total_ram LOG.info('total RAM: %s MiB', total_ram) else: LOG.warn('failed to get RAM information') for key in ('cpus', 'local_gb', 'memory_mb'): try: data[key] = int(data[key]) except (KeyError, ValueError, TypeError): LOG.warn('value for %s is missing or malformed: %s', key, data.get(key)) data[key] = None # FIXME(dtantsur): -1 is required to give Ironic some spacing for # partitioning and may be removed later if data['local_gb']: data['local_gb'] = data['local_gb'] / 1024 / 1024 / 1024 - 1 if data['local_gb'] < 1: LOG.warn('local_gb is less than 1 GiB') data['local_gb'] = None def discover_block_devices(data): block_devices = base.try_shell( "lsblk -no TYPE,SERIAL | grep disk | awk '{print $2}'") if not block_devices: LOG.warn('unable to get block devices') return serials = [item for item in block_devices.split('\n') if item.strip()] data['block_devices'] = {'serials': serials} def collect(args, data, failures): base.try_call('modprobe', 'ipmi_msghandler') base.try_call('modprobe', 'ipmi_devintf') base.try_call('modprobe', 'ipmi_si') discover_basic_properties(data, args) discover_network_interfaces(data, failures) discover_scheduling_properties(data, failures) discover_block_devices(data)

commit_message:
Set single memcache host for keystone cache

 Now we have a list of memcache hosts in keystone.conf and each
 host is a controller. When some of controllers goes down we need to
 wait socket_timeout seconds for check this host. If we set a single
 host to memcache_servers we don't need wait and connect somewhere.

Change-Id: I40523393e53cf2b458bc5ced33a6271d4869d450
Closes-bug: #1471264

Unit test for describing of creating images

Change-Id: I1190dc96b579887f425adea7e11f7fcbef1ac447

added_lines: def test_describe_images_being_created(self): db_api = self.mock_db() glance = self.mock_glance() context = base.create_context() image_id = fakes.random_ec2_id('ami') image = {'id': image_id, 'os_id': None, 'is_public': False, 'description': 'fake desc'} db_api.set_mock_items(image) db_api.get_public_items.return_value = [] # describe cases when no glance image exists glance.images.list.return_value = [] expected = {'imagesSet': [{'imageId': image_id, 'description': 'fake desc', 'imageOwnerId': fakes.ID_OS_PROJECT, 'imageState': 'pending', 'imageType': 'machine', 'isPublic': False}]} # describe all images result = image_api.describe_images(context) self.assertEqual(expected, result) # describe the image result = image_api.describe_images(context, image_id=[image_id]) self.assertEqual(expected, result) # describe failed image image['state'] = 'failed' expected['imagesSet'][0]['imageState'] = 'failed' result = image_api.describe_images(base.create_context()) self.assertEqual(expected, result) # describe cases when glance image exists, db item is yet not updated del image['state'] os_image_id = fakes.random_os_id() os_image = {'id': os_image_id, 'owner': fakes.ID_OS_PROJECT, 'status': 'active', 'is_public': False, 'properties': {'ec2_id': image_id}} glance.images.list.return_value = [fakes.OSImage(os_image)] expected['imagesSet'] = [{ 'architecture': None, 'creationDate': None, 'description': 'fake desc', 'imageId': image_id, 'imageLocation': 'None (None)', 'imageOwnerId': fakes.ID_OS_PROJECT, 'imageState': 'available', 'imageType': 'machine', 'isPublic': False, 'name': None, 'rootDeviceType': 'instance-store'}] # describe all images result = image_api.describe_images(context) self.assertEqual(expected, result) db_api.update_item.assert_called_once_with( context, tools.update_dict(image, {'os_id': os_image_id})) # describe the image db_api.reset_mock() result = image_api.describe_images(context, image_id=[image_id]) self.assertEqual(expected, result) db_api.update_item.assert_called_once_with( context, tools.update_dict(image, {'os_id': os_image_id}))

commit_message:
Extract DB mock to a separate test mixin class

We need to have powerful mock db features outside of ApiTestCase.

Change-Id: I1bf199ee523650c2a05b562949a1027892d1e410
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ec2-api refs/changes/57/222457/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class MockDBMixin(object): def mock_db(self): db_api_patcher = mock.patch('ec2api.db.api.IMPL', autospec=db_backend) db_api = db_api_patcher.start() self.addCleanup(db_api_patcher.stop) def set_mock_items(*items): db_api.__db_items = copy.copy(items) db_api.get_items.side_effect = ( tools.get_db_api_get_items(*db_api.__db_items)) db_api.get_item_by_id.side_effect = ( tools.get_db_api_get_item_by_id(*db_api.__db_items)) db_api.get_items_by_ids.side_effect = ( tools.get_db_api_get_items_by_ids(*db_api.__db_items)) db_api.get_items_ids.side_effect = ( tools.get_db_api_get_items_ids(*db_api.__db_items)) def add_mock_items(*items): merged_items = items + tuple(item for item in db_api.__db_items if all(i['id'] != item['id'] for i in items)) db_api.set_mock_items(*merged_items) setattr(db_api, 'set_mock_items', set_mock_items) setattr(db_api, 'add_mock_items', add_mock_items) return db_api class BaseTestCase(MockOSMixin, MockDBMixin, test_base.BaseTestCase): self.db_api = self.mock_db() self.db_api.set_mock_items(*items) self.db_api.add_mock_items(*items)
deleted_lines: class BaseTestCase(MockOSMixin, test_base.BaseTestCase): db_api_patcher = mock.patch('ec2api.db.api.IMPL', autospec=db_backend) self.db_api = db_api_patcher.start() self.addCleanup(db_api_patcher.stop) self._db_items = copy.copy(items) self.db_api.get_items.side_effect = ( tools.get_db_api_get_items(*self._db_items)) self.db_api.get_item_by_id.side_effect = ( tools.get_db_api_get_item_by_id(*self._db_items)) self.db_api.get_items_by_ids.side_effect = ( tools.get_db_api_get_items_by_ids(*self._db_items)) self.db_api.get_items_ids.side_effect = ( tools.get_db_api_get_items_ids(*self._db_items)) merged_items = items + tuple(item for item in self._db_items if all(i['id'] != item['id'] for i in items)) self.set_mock_db_items(*merged_items)

commit_message:
Remove support of old or absend OS client

Since requirements.txt requres all used OS clients to be present, it
isn't needed to workaround their absence.
Also since required novaclient version supports microversions, it isn't
needed to check microversions support of client.

Change-Id: Ie7f1ca4c0b1ca5661fd76b3fbcb4d661c68e0362

commit_message:
acceptance: switch RDO to CBS repositories

This patch changes the repositories used to install OpenStack Liberty on
RDO by using CBS repositories and RDO trunk.

Here is the RDO roadmap that is suggested if we want to run Liberty:
From now until GA:
http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-liberty/current/
http://cbs.centos.org/repos/cloud7-openstack-liberty-testing/x86_64/os/
http://cbs.centos.org/repos/cloud7-openstack-common-testing/x86_64/os/

After GA:
http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/openstack-liberty

Note about EPEL: deps from EPEL are rebuilt in CBS, so EPEL could be
disabled in the future.

Change-Id: I46f18c26664d7c24914428d56bd24c49ed3f5bbf

commit_message:
acceptance: bump to Liberty

RDO:
This patch changes the repositories used to install OpenStack Liberty on
RDO by using CBS repositories and RDO trunk.

Here is the RDO roadmap that is suggested if we want to run Liberty:
From now until GA:
http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-liberty/current/
http://cbs.centos.org/repos/cloud7-openstack-liberty-testing/x86_64/os/
http://cbs.centos.org/repos/cloud7-openstack-common-testing/x86_64/os/

After GA:
http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/openstack-liberty

Note about EPEL: deps from EPEL are rebuilt in CBS, so EPEL could be
disabled in the future.

UCA:
Since our recent discussion about Ubuntu packaging, we decided to bump
Ubuntu packaging to trusty-proposed/liberty so we can install Liberty in
a better shape than current situation (Staging repo). This patch
installs UCA liberty repository.

Change-Id: Idd0beeec65b15798a015fa1c71486c75795d14ee

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-10 14:02:05.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/galera_config/templates/my.cnf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/09870e589eaea11e3d5f5d184266d017c3965131', 'message': 'Enable log_slave_updates

Without log_slave_updates enabled, the bin logs are only written on the
cluster server that handles the request. This makes database recovery
more difficult as the bin logs are spread across all servers and must be
combined manually in order to recover the database.

Enabling log_slave_updates ensures all nodes in the cluster contain the

  rpc_deployment/roles/galera_config/templates/my.cnf

Change-Id: I978d6aea93369382faeace96b7865b9e56a7995a
Closes-Bug: #1479473
(cherry picked from commit 41332ab35f5ff667cd5d3fdbecf03ffac0e87147)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable log_slave_updates

Without log_slave_updates enabled, the bin logs are only written on the
cluster server that handles the request. This makes database recovery
more difficult as the bin logs are spread across all servers and must be
combined manually in order to recover the database.

Enabling log_slave_updates ensures all nodes in the cluster contain the
complete bin logs and recovery can be performed from any cluster member.

Conflicts:
  rpc_deployment/roles/galera_config/templates/my.cnf

Change-Id: I978d6aea93369382faeace96b7865b9e56a7995a
Closes-Bug: #1479473
(cherry picked from commit 41332ab35f5ff667cd5d3fdbecf03ffac0e87147)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/98/222198/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log_slave_updates = 1

commit_message:
Add package_manifest resource.

This patch converts the write_package_names function into
a proper resource. Using the write_package_names only works
if the function comes last in the puppet manifest. By
making the same functionality a custom resource we allow
for it to exist anywhere in the manifest and provide the
same functionality.

 The new syntax would be:

 package_manifest{'/tmp/foo': ensure => present}

Co-Authored-By: Martin Mágr <mmagr@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If3e03b1983fed47082fac8ce63f975557dbc503c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/03/203803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Puppet::Type.type(:package_manifest).provide(:flat_file) do desc "Write package manifest to a flat file" def exists? false # Always write a fresh manifest end def create packages = resource.catalog.resources.collect { |r| r.title if r.type == :package }.compact FileUtils.mkdir_p(File.dirname(resource[:path])) File.open(resource[:path], 'w') do |f| packages.each do |pkg_name| f.puts(pkg_name) end end end def destroy File.delete(resource[:path]) end end

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-20 02:08:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/ba88ba0a3af8d35e4c3060cb6d2d00b2a1639d85', 'message': 'Dummy Driver

This driver is an extremely simple driver that uses the
NFS-kernel-server on the manila-share node.
It simply creates directories and exports them.
This way the driver would be functional and usable but
with no extra complexity.

We hope this driver would be an example of pattern.
It separate the way manila consumes resources from
a description of the resource itself, and make it
a little easier to the person who is looking at it
for the first time.

Share-Server
Share-server contains information about "how" and "where" to
get shares. It is a container of shares, with all "resource",
including network and so on for a share.

Driver Mode
There are two driver modes in Manila:
    driver_handles_share_servers = True/False.
The difference between the two type of drivers are whether
manila create/delete share-servers while the creation/deletion of shares.

Base on "Share Server" & "Driver Mode", dummy driver indicates:
1. Each share has a share-server. It contains all infomation (resources)
   related to the share. All driver specific infomation are
   put into share-server['backend_details']. For dummy, the
   share-server['backend_details'] is the manila-share services'
   host ip, because the NFS-kernel-server is on the host.
2. For driver_handles_share_servers = False, manila use resources
   directly without extra operations. The resources are come from
   configurations which fullfilled by admin. For dummy, admin
   need to start NFS-kernel-server on host before using Manila.
3. For driver_handles_share_servers = True, manila would do extra
   actions to the "resource". For dummy, the driver would try to
   start the NFS-kernel-server itself.

Note:
1. Driver can create more than one share-server when it is working
   under driver_handles_share_servers = True. Share-network tied shares
   and their share-servers.
2. How to create real "resources" for share-server is depend on drivers.
   E.g: generic driver creates a instance in nova, EMC VNX driver creates
   VDMs on their array. Dummy start service as a symbolic significance.

Implements blueprint: dummy-driver

Change-Id: I7a6b475892a47935c414ae85a5380a1318ff0115

2. For driver_handles_share_servers = False, manila use
   resources directly without extra operations. The resources
   are come from configurations which fullfilled by admin.
   For dummy, admin need to start NFS-kernel-server on
   the host which is running manila-share service.

3. For driver_handles_share_servers = True, manila would do
   extra actions to "create resources". For dummy, driver
   would start the NFS-kernel-server.

1. Driver can create more than one share-server for both driver mode.
   Share-network tied shares and their share-servers.

2. How to create real "resources" for share-server is depend on drivers.

commit_message:
Dummy Driver

This driver is an extremely simple driver that uses the
NFS-kernel-server on the manila-share node.
It simply creates directories and exports them.
This way the driver would be functional and usable but
with no extra complexity.

We hope this driver would be an example of pattern.
It separate the way manila consumes resources from
a description of the resource itself, and make it
a little easier to the person who is looking at it
for the first time.

Share-Server

Share-server contains information about "how" and
"where" to get shares. It is a container of shares,
with all "resource", including network and so on for a share.

Driver Mode

There are two driver modes in Manila:
    driver_handles_share_servers = True/False.
The difference between the two type of drivers are
whether manila create/delete share-servers while the
creation/deletion of shares.

Base on "Share Server" & "Driver Mode", dummy driver indicates:

1. Each share has a share-server.
   It contains all infomation (resources) related to the share.
   All driver specific infomation are put into
   share-server['backend_details']. For dummy, the
   share-server['backend_details'] is the manila-share
   services' host ip, because the NFS-kernel-server is on the host.

2. For driver_handles_share_servers = False, manila use
   resources directly without extra operations. The resources
   are come from configurations which fullfilled by admin.
   For dummy, admin need to start NFS-kernel-server on
   the host which is running manila-share service.

3. For driver_handles_share_servers = True, manila would do
   extra actions to "create resources". For dummy, driver
   would start the NFS-kernel-server.

Note:

1. Driver can create more than one share-server for both driver mode.
   Share-network tied shares and their share-servers.

2. How to create real "resources" for share-server is depend on drivers.
   E.g: generic driver creates a instance in nova, EMC VNX driver creates
   VDMs on their array. Dummy start service as a symbolic significance.

Implements blueprint: dummy-driver

Change-Id: I7a6b475892a47935c414ae85a5380a1318ff0115

Using good_discovery from the pypowervm module

Changes to remove the redundant definition of good_discovery
and make use of a pypowervm interface.

commit_message:
Fixed Hive 1.0 failure on MapR plugin

Failure was caused because Hive 1.0 doesn't
contain schema for 1.0. Instead it uses schema
for Hive 0.14.

Closes-Bug: #1493355

commit_message:
Cache the description of RAID properties

The GET /v1/drivers/DDDD/raid/logical_disk_properties retrieves a
description of the properties for logical disks that can be specified
for a node with driver DDD. Since this information doesn't change
over the lifetime of a conductor, we cache that information at the
API layer.

Change-Id: Ic09b8f1b907975c72abc26b4553619cd2c052bf9
Implements: blueprint ironic-generic-raid-interface

Remove primary-controller condition from haproxy primitive

commit_message:
Add workaround for apache restart during deployment

As figured out in the following launcpad bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1493353
Apache2 is not very friendly to any types of
restarts. This may lead to the issue when we
restart apache to often during deployment and
it gets into Byzantine unresponsive state
along with keystone which breaks keystone
providers operations.

Change-Id: I11c52089e9598fc6d088c3478c90de3aa853652a
Closes-bug: #1493372
Related-bug: #1493353
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/62/222362/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: restart => 'sleep 30 && apachectl graceful || apachectl restart',

commit_message:
Allow testing of cinder multi backends w/ tempest

This commit adds the following variables to os_tempest role:

tempest_volume_backend1_name
tempest_volume_backend2_name
tempest_volume_multi_backend_enabled

This allows you to test that using multiple cinder backends
simultaneously works as expected.  A deployer may, for example, set
tempest_volume_backend1_name to 'lvm' and tempest_volume_backend2_name
to 'ceph'.

To avoid any surprises, tempest_volume_multi_backend_enabled defaults to
'False', which is the current tempest default value for multi_backend.

Closes-Bug: #1493911

Change-Id: I5eeb88d3e90b6ca046be96fb61a1cb6f4e6087ee
(cherry picked from commit ed4ed6aa20793dd13487b42e80e4886d35fdd768)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/19/222119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tempest_volume_backend1_name: backend1 tempest_volume_backend2_name: backend2tempest_volume_multi_backend_enabled: False

commit_message:
Add test to check that correct functions is used in expand/contract

This test will check that expand branch does not contain drop SQLAlchemy
operations and contract branch does not contain create/add SQLAlchemy
operations.

Partially-Implements: blueprint online-schema-migrations

Change-Id: Ifda31c0599651931c1a98f673f3b10e64538f18b
Related-bug: #1490767
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/221712/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import neutron.db.migration as migration_help def test_branches(self): def check_expand_branch(conn, clauseelement, multiparams, params): if isinstance(clauseelement, migration_help.DROP_OPERATIONS): self.fail("Migration from expand branch contains drop command") def check_contract_branch(conn, clauseelement, multiparams, params): if isinstance(clauseelement, migration_help.CREATION_OPERATIONS): # Skip tables that were created by mistake in contract branch if hasattr(clauseelement, 'element'): element = clauseelement.element if any([ isinstance(element, sqlalchemy.Table) and element.name in ['ml2_geneve_allocations', 'ml2_geneve_endpoints'], isinstance(element, sqlalchemy.ForeignKeyConstraint) and element.table.name == 'flavorserviceprofilebindings', isinstance(element, sqlalchemy.Index) and element.table.name == 'ml2_geneve_allocations' ]): return self.fail("Migration from contract branch contains create " "command") engine = self.get_engine() cfg.CONF.set_override('connection', engine.url, group='database') migration.do_alembic_command(self.alembic_config, 'upgrade', 'kilo') with self._listener(sqlalchemy.engine.Engine, check_expand_branch): migration.do_alembic_command(self.alembic_config, 'upgrade', '%s@head' % migration.EXPAND_BRANCH) with self._listener(sqlalchemy.engine.Engine, check_contract_branch): migration.do_alembic_command(self.alembic_config, 'upgrade', '%s@head' % migration.CONTRACT_BRANCH)

This PR replaces the copy_update module with a proper Ansible action
plugin. This change allows for dynamic updates to configuration files
that are ini, json, and yaml.

All of the policy files have been moved to the role templates directories
and the task syntax has been updated to facilitate the new action plugin.

An entry has been added to the ansible.cfg file to inform Ansible to look
into the new directory. In order for the action plugin to work as a
"module" a virtual module was added to the library directory.

Change-Id: I80331628b2c3d426a95c89d9c1b766e2e3f70e6d

commit_message:
Replaced the copy_update module

This PR replaces the copy_update module with a proper Ansible action
plugin. This change allows for dynamic updates to configuration files
that are ini, json, and yaml.

All of the policy files have been moved to the role templates directories
and the task syntax has been updated to facilitate the new action plugin.

An entry has been added to the ansible.cfg file to inform Ansible to look
into the new directory. In order for the action plugin to work as a
"module" a virtual module was added to the library directory.

Change-Id: I80331628b2c3d426a95c89d9c1b766e2e3f70e6d
Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

commit_message:
Added testcase for glance

1. list image with name
2. list image with owner
3. list image with sort_key
4. list image with sort_dir

Added _sort_list_by_param_value_and_assert() to verify sorted
image list according to sort_key and sort_dir parameters.

Change-Id: I0f43ce2c5e5223ba876d162100db37588dae2ea2
Blueprint: testcases-expansion-icehouse
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/69/81769/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _sort_list_by_param_value_and_assert(self, params): """ Sort the list based on given parameters and validates the result. """ # By default image list gets sorted by name if 'sort_key' not in params: params.update({'sort_key': 'name'}) # fetching image list without passing parameters to # verify the results resp, images_list = self.client.image_list() self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) # fetching image list with parameters to # verify the results resp, images_sorted_list = self.client.image_list(params=params) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) # Validating params of fetched images actual_list = map(lambda x: x[params['sort_key']], images_list) # By default sort_dir is set to desc in image list api, # so reversing the list to match with sorted list actual_list.sort(reverse=True) sorted_list = map(lambda x: x[params['sort_key']], images_sorted_list) self.assertEqual(sorted_list, actual_list) def test_list_images_param_name(self): # Test to get all images by name resp, image = self.client.get_image(self.created_images[1]) self.assertEqual(resp['status'], '200') params = {"name": image['name']} self._list_by_param_value_and_assert(params) @test.attr(type='gate') def test_list_images_param_owner(self): # Test to get all images by owner resp, image = self.client.get_image(self.created_images[1]) self.assertEqual(resp['status'], '200') params = {"owner": image['owner']} self._list_by_param_value_and_assert(params) @test.attr(type='gate') def test_list_images_param_sort_dir(self): # Test to get all images by sort_dir params = {"sort_dir": "desc"} self._sort_list_by_param_value_and_assert(params) @test.attr(type='gate') def test_list_images_param_sort_key(self): # Test to get all images by sort_key params = {"sort_key": "size"} self._sort_list_by_param_value_and_assert(params) @test.attr(type='gate')

commit_message:
Fix search for test groups in upload_cases_description.py

Test groups were taken from jenkins job names. But jenkins
job name is not connected to actually used test group, for example:

Job name: 7.0.system_test.ubuntu.test.upgrade.chain
Upgrade test group: upgrade_second_stage

This patch is looking for '--group=...' in the console output of
each job, and use it instead of the name that is used in jenkins
job suffix.

Jenkins job suffix is used for expanding common test group names.

Change-Id: Iaa6def59337175b537f660b3d174f71fddf04e64
Closes-Bug:#1485308
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/03/222503/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for jenkins_suffix in groups: group = groups[jenkins_suffix] title = ' - '.join([title, jenkins_suffix]) test_group = '_'.join([case.entry.home.func_name, jenkins_suffix]) res = {} for b in runner_build.build_data['subBuilds']: # Get the test group from the console of the job z = Build(b['jobName'], b['buildNumber']) console = z.get_job_console() groups = [keyword.split('=')[1] for line in console for keyword in line.split() if 'run_tests.py' in line and '--group=' in keyword] if not groups: logger.error("No test group found in console of the job {0}/{1}" .format(b['jobName'], b['buildNumber'])) continue # Use the last group (there can be several groups in upgrade jobs) test_group = groups[-1] # Get the job suffix job_suffix = job_name.split(sep)[-1] job_suffix = job_name.split('.')[-1] res[job_suffix] = test_group
deleted_lines: for group in groups: title = ' - '.join([title, group]) test_group = '_'.join([case.entry.home.func_name, group]) res = [] for b in runner_build.build_data['subBuilds']: res.append(job_name.split(sep)[-1]) res.append(job_name.split('.')[-1])

added_lines: def _test_help(self, command): stdout, stderr = self.shell(command) def test_help(self): self._test_help('help') def test_help_option(self): self._test_help('--help') self._test_help('-h') def test_help_no_subcommand(self): self._test_help('')

commit_message:
Display the project name in user detail page

In the user detail page, only display the "Project ID",
now display the "Project Name" corresponding to the
"Project ID".

Change-Id: Id54352a2659146787a913f26df9d49d0ae84261d
Closes-Bug: #1479171

commit_message:
Full response for database flavor client methods

Provide the entire response object for all methods of the
DatabaseFlavorsClient

partially implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib

Change-Id: I4909c87818cfbd2a34824b402265c70ced0cc87c

commit_message:
Allow for authentication in functional tests

Allow for authenticating when running zaqarclient's functional tests so
that they can also be used in the gate and keystone mechanism can be
tested functionally

Change-Id: I0f1fd4374125d4b489f3804b79a672b39c714421
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient refs/changes/75/221175/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _USE_AUTHENTICATION = os.environ.get('ZAQARCLIENT_AUTH_FUNCTIONAL', False) _RUN_FUNCTIONAL = os.environ.get('ZAQARCLIENT_TEST_FUNCTIONAL', _USE_AUTHENTICATION) elif self.is_functional and _USE_AUTHENTICATION: self._setup_auth_params() def _setup_auth_params(self): # NOTE(flaper87): Hard-code the backend for now since it's the # only one we support self.conf['auth_opts']['backend'] = 'keystone' if 'OS_TOKEN' in os.environ and 'OS_AUTH_URL' in os.environ: options = {'os_token': os.environ['OS_TOKEN'], 'os_auth_url': os.environ['OS_AUTH_URL']} else: options = {'os_username': os.environ['OS_USERNAME'], 'os_password': os.environ['OS_PASSWORD'], 'os_project_id': os.environ['OS_PROJECT_ID'], 'os_project_name': os.environ['OS_PROJECT_NAME'], 'os_auth_url': os.environ['OS_AUTH_URL'], 'insecure': ''} self.conf['auth_opts'].setdefault('options', {}).update(options)

commit_message:
Fix the typo "version"

In manila-manage.rst version is misspelled
it is corrected. In manage.py according to
help option I changed revision to version

Change-Id: Icc83b3dcfc31104a015c9e6929335daed5a8bb8b
Closes-Bug: #1487249

revisions:

Change-Id: I765e34497e7184f4500f365b46d1c9dff13a2ecb
"}]
commit_message:
Don't pass `options` to pool creation

Options, in the pool constructor, are taken from the extra keywords.
Passing `options` generates: 'options': {'options': {}}

Change-Id: I765e34497e7184f4500f365b46d1c9dff13a2ecb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient refs/changes/61/222161/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Don't reuse request and transport instances
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-10 12:16:30.000000000', 'files': ['zaqarclient/queues/v1/flavor.py', 'zaqarclient/queues/v1/pool.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient/commit/8104ff488bf74dea82b4de4e88563c6b9e1299f3', 'message': "Don't reuse request and transport instances

Re-using these instances was causing request failures when talking to
`uwsgi`. I still don't know the exact cause - probably something related
to the headers or even cached in the `http.Client` instance - but this
does fix the current issue and it also makes sense to have a new request
object for every request.

Change-Id: I30f78e048eea7105e4cced4530b165ad7a25d914
"}]
commit_message:
Don't reuse request and transport instances

Re-using these instances was causing request failures when talking to
`uwsgi`. I still don't know the exact cause - probably something related
to the headers or even cached in the `http.Client` instance - but this
does fix the current issue and it also makes sense to have a new request
object for every request.

Change-Id: I30f78e048eea7105e4cced4530b165ad7a25d914
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient refs/changes/60/222160/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Pass `group` in pool's functional tests

The `group` key was missing in the pool's functional tests. This commit
adds it, otherwise these tests will fail.

commit_message:
Allow method _create_network to create shared
networks with admin credentials

This option is not passed in parameters
allowed on network creation, which prevents
it from be used in tests with shared networks.

Closes-Bug: #1484979
Change-Id: I1a8dcca61f1088bb849a799c6289a24f662b244e

commit_message:
Clarify hot_spec description of latest HOT version

Aligns the wording with previous summary blocks and highlights the
addition of the str_split function.  Also clarifies the new
support for multiple lists for list_join, which is new for liberty.

Change-Id: I3ed8f38e3246ac5407233204deee9569d0ef190f

commit_message:
Add profiling for Ansible tasks

This should help find the slowest Ansible tasks that need to be optimized.

It is only enabled by default for gate jobs.

The profiling callback code is MIT licensed.  Per legal-discuss, I've added
the MIT license to the LICENSE.txt at the root of the repository along with
a note about which code is MIT licensed.

Thread on legal-discuss:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/legal-discuss/2015-September/000398.html

Closes-Bug: #1488639

Change-Id: I46a2c495d9f8f1131ec08be99696efc39133f291
(cherry picked from commit 059cae3d76c1922f98dac9524c061addb009fbd5)

commit_message:
Update swarm discovery url

The swarm discovery url has been updated in upstream https://github.
com/docker/swarm/commit/6678a167fe873a320d00aa99be09945ac5f9ca96.
Magnum needs to be in sync. And the magnum.conf.sample needs to be
re-generated.

Change-Id: I922af4e784a1a533c92e9dd0665e5b06199b4786
Closes-Bug: #1493553

commit_message:
Add workaround for apache restart during deployment

As figured out in the following launcpad bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1493353
Apache2 is not very friendly to any types of
restarts. This may lead to the issue when we
restart apache to often during deployment and
it gets into Byzantine unresponsive state
along with keystone which breaks keystone
providers operations.

Change-Id: I11c52089e9598fc6d088c3478c90de3aa853652a
Closes-bug: #1493372
Related-bug: #1493353
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/60/222360/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: restart => 'sleep 30 && apachectl graceful || apachectl restart',

added_lines: import sys def prepare_to_run_command(self, cmd): """Check CLI options """ required_opts = ('os_auth_url', 'os_username', 'os_password') for option in required_opts: if getattr(self.options, option, None): continue msg = "Please specify either the --%s" % option.replace('_', '-') msg += " option or the %s environment variable" % option.upper() print(msg) sys.exit(1) if not (self.options.os_project_id or self.options.os_tenant_id or self.options.os_project_name or self.options.os_tenant_name): print( "Please specify either one of the options: " "--os-project-id " "--os-project-name " "--os-tenant-id " "--os-tenant-name\n" "Or one of the environment variables: " "OS_PROJECT_ID " "OS_PROJECT_NAME " "OS_TENANT_ID " "OS_TENANT_NAME" ) sys.exit(1)

commit_message:
acceptance: switch RDO to CBS repositories

This patch changes the repositories used to install OpenStack Liberty on
RDO by using CBS repositories and RDO trunk.

Here is the RDO roadmap that is suggested if we want to run Liberty:
From now until GA:
http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-liberty/current/
http://cbs.centos.org/repos/cloud7-openstack-liberty-testing/x86_64/os/
http://cbs.centos.org/repos/cloud7-openstack-common-testing/x86_64/os/

After GA:
http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/openstack-liberty

Note about EPEL: deps from EPEL are rebuilt in CBS, so EPEL could be
disabled in the future.

Change-Id: I67e7e676d9d9351628d341fb61797f36898d372f

subject: [Reports] Add method objects.Task.extend_results()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 16:17:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/4e7977b26c37684d174c9ad311303ad24ac7b0b3', 'message': '[Reports] Add method objects.Task._prepare_task_results()

This patch introduces method Task._prepare_task_results()
that will be in use in next patch.

This method processes task results and reorganizes/modifies
them. The main modification is adding `info' part with
aggregated data about task results (for example:
maximum/minimum duration, iterations count and so on).
This aggregated data will be used by new reports charts
classes, since streaming processing of benchmark results is
impossible without this meta data.
In other side, this aggregated info must be stored in the
database, so this method is only temporary workaround and
should be removed in future after planned changes in database.

Also there is a tasks results schema change
(like ["data"]["raw"] -> ["result"]) since this change is
actually being made in other places, so that is a
convenient refactoring.

Change-Id: I8de5a6243f99ed5c7d9b4fa422afc5787e860387

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-26 15:25:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/4579ff971249144fc7a2dcb7cab1623102e3e0fd', 'message': "[Reports] Add method objects.Task.get_results_with_info()

This patch introduces method Task.get_results_with_info()
that will be in use in next patch.

This method processes task results and reorganizes/modifies
them. The main modifications are:
  * is adding `info' part for each scenario results, with
    aggregated data (like maximum/minimum duration, iterations
    count and so on)
  * iterarions becomes an iterator
This data representation will be used by new reports charts
classes, since they use streaming data processing.

In other side, this method is a workaround because aggregated
data and iterations generator should be obtained as-is directly
from the database api, so this method is expected to be
simplified in future after planned database refactoring.

Change-Id: I8de5a6243f99ed5c7d9b4fa422afc5787e860387

them. The main modifications are:
  * is adding `info' part for each scenario results, with
    aggregated data (like maximum/minimum duration, iterations
    count and so on)
  * iterations data now is an iterator
This data representation will be used by new reports charts
classes, since they use streaming data processing.

In other side, this method is a workaround because aggregated
data and iterations generator should be obtained as-is directly
from the database api, so this method is expected to be
simplified in future after planned database refactoring.

Change-Id: I8de5a6243f99ed5c7d9b4fa422afc5787e860387

commit_message:
[Reports] Add method objects.Task.extend_results()

This patch introduces method Task.extend_results()
that will be in use in next patch.

This method processes task results and extends/reorganizes them:
  * adds `info' part for each scenario results, with
    aggregated data (like maximum/minimum duration, iterations
    count and so on)
  * iterations data is transformed into iterator

This data representation will be used by new reports charts
classes, since they use streaming data processing.

In other side, this method is a workaround, because aggregated
data and iterations iterator should be obtained as-is directly
from the database api, so this method is expected to be
simplified in future after planned database refactoring.

Change-Id: I8de5a6243f99ed5c7d9b4fa422afc5787e860387

added_lines: def _prepare_task_results(self, task_results, serializable=False): """Workaround for task results. TODO(amaretskiy): This is a workaround method that should be removed after task_results[N]["info"] comes directly from the db, and task_results[N]["data"]["raw"] becomes a generator. :param task_results: list of db.sqlalchemy.models.TaskResult instances :param serializable: bool, whether to convert json non-serializable types (like datetime) to serializable :returns: list of dicts, each dict is extended TaskResult data """ results = [] for bench_result in task_results: bench = dict(bench_result) tstamp_start = 0 min_duration = 0 max_duration = 0 iterations_passed = 0 atomic = {} output_names = set() output_count = 0 for itr in bench["data"]["raw"]: for atomic_name, duration in itr["atomic_actions"].items(): duration = duration or 0 if atomic_name not in atomic: atomic[atomic_name] = {"min_duration": duration, "max_duration": duration} continue if (duration < atomic[atomic_name]["min_duration"] or not atomic[atomic_name]["min_duration"]): atomic[atomic_name]["min_duration"] = duration elif duration > atomic[atomic_name]["max_duration"]: atomic[atomic_name]["max_duration"] = duration output_names.update(itr["scenario_output"]["data"].keys()) output_count += len(itr["scenario_output"]["data"]) if not tstamp_start or itr["timestamp"] < tstamp_start: tstamp_start = itr["timestamp"] duration = itr["duration"] or 0 if not itr["error"]: iterations_passed += 1 if not min_duration or duration < min_duration: min_duration = duration if not max_duration or duration > max_duration: max_duration = duration for k in "created_at", "updated_at": if not serializable: del bench[k] elif bench[k]: bench[k] = bench[k].strftime("%Y-%d-%mT%H:%M:%S") bench["info"] = { "atomic": atomic, "output_names": list(output_names), "output_count": output_count, "iterations_count": len(bench["data"]["raw"]), "iterations_passed": iterations_passed, "min_duration": min_duration, "max_duration": max_duration, "tstamp_start": tstamp_start, "full_duration": bench["data"]["full_duration"], "load_duration": bench["data"]["load_duration"]} bench["result"] = bench["data"]["raw"] bench["sla"] = bench["data"]["sla"] del bench["data"] del bench["task_uuid"] del bench["id"] results.append(bench) return results

commit_message:
Use keystone service for regular context initialization

Using session is a recommended way to provide auth data to OS clients.

Change-Id: I267847b2be9938d991c4c988f65179e2303545ec

commit_message:
Use keystone session for admin context

Since that oslo_context is used in ec2api, admin context is cached
between service calls. This leads to that context auth token becomes
outdated, because it has no renewal logic. This is not a big problem for
ec2api service, because each new initialization of regular context
overwrites a previous cached context. But this is a problem for metadata
service, where is no regular context used.

Instead of disabling caching of admin contexts this patch uses the
caching in a separate thread storage. To handle token outdating Keystone
session is used.

Change-Id: I714419dc193471dde8a15715cbaeec83896809c9

Creating of an image by a running instance stops the instance. This
takes a time, and a client can resend the request due to timeout. The
resended request fails because instance is already not in appropriate
state (it's stoping, stopped, or scheduling at the moment).

Thus ec2api should make such images asynchronously. It should create a
DB item to reserve the image id, return it to a caller, and then stop
the instance and do other things. While image is asynchronously created
and no Glance image exists, ec2api should return the image in responses
for describe operation. Describe operation should return the image with
and without selective filter by the image id passed in.

Also it should consider a race when asynchronous task has not finished,
but Glance image is already created, and another client describe images.
In that case ec2api should not create a new db item, but reuse existed
one.

If the creation failed, ec2api should expose the image as failed and
allow to delete it.

Unit tests for auto_update_db and handle_unpaired_item will be added in
a separate review, because some refactoring is required for that.

Change-Id: Iba4ade5000bea4af35d97abd1e708bbbc57f372a
"}]
commit_message:
Create an image in a separate thread

Creating of an image by a running instance stops the instance. This
takes a time, and a client can resend the request due to timeout. The
resended request fails because instance is already not in appropriate
state (it's stoping, stopped, or scheduling at the moment).

Thus ec2api should make such images asynchronously. It should create a
DB item to reserve the image id, return it to a caller, and then stop
the instance and do other things. While image is asynchronously created
and no Glance image exists, ec2api should return the image in responses
for describe operation. Describe operation should return the image with
and without selective filter by the image id passed in.

Also it should consider a race when asynchronous task has not finished,
but Glance image is already created, and another client describe images.
In that case ec2api should not create a new db item, but reuse existed
one.

If the creation failed, ec2api should expose the image as failed and
allow to delete it.

Unit tests for auto_update_db and handle_unpaired_item will be added in
a separate review, because some refactoring is required for that.

Change-Id: Iba4ade5000bea4af35d97abd1e708bbbc57f372a

commit_message:
Refresh list of online DHCP agents after reset

Get list of online DHCP agents for 'net04' network after
node reset and re-initialize SSH connection to remote.
Also create RSA key pair using API and copy private key
on node before connecting to instance via SSH.

Change-Id: Ia3d04fc1297c7075473f0c8184ca78d7472af5a7
Partial-bug: #1493228

commit_message:
Log a warning if multiple drivers configured

Log a warning on service plugin startup if multiple service
drivers are configured for our plugin.

Change-Id: Ia04f7136acc00b37d386168f3dfde449d0db969c
Closes-bug: 1492323

commit_message:
Trusted boot doc

Add a section in install-guide about how to enable "trusted boot".

Change-Id: If1ba7116f1e1a9b55d6c47bab7401615a3e2bae8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/38/208438/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Trusted boot with partition image ================================= Starting with the Liberty release, Ironic supports trusted boot with partition image. This means after the depoloyment, the node's subsequent reboot will go for ``trusted boot`` which measures the node's BIOS, boot loader, Option ROM and the Kernel/Ramdisk, to determine whether a bare metal node deployed by Ironic should be trusted. It's important to note that in order for this to work the node being deployed **must** has Intel TXT[3]_ hardware support. The image being deployed with Ironic must contain ``oat-client`` installed within it. The following sections will describe how to enable ``trusted boot`` and boot with PXE and Nova, there is not much different when used with PXE and iPXE: #. Create a customized image with ``oat-client`` installed:: disk-image-create -u fedora ... oat-client ... -o $TRUST_IMG #. Enable VT-x, VT-d, TXT, TPM on the node, this can be done manually through BIOS. Depends on the platform, several reboots are needed. #. Update the node capability value:: ironic node-update $NODE_UUID add \ properties/capabilities={'trusted_boot':true} #. Create a special flavor:: nova flavor-key $TRUST_FLAVOR_UUID set 'capabilities:trusted_boot'=true #. Prepare tboot[4]_ and mboot.c32 and put them into tftp_root or http_root directory:: Ubuntu: cp /usr/lib/syslinux/mboot.c32 /tftpboot/ Fedora: cp /usr/share/syslinux/mboot.c32 /tftpboot/ *Note: tboot has to be downloaded from https://sourceforge.net/projects/tboot/files/latest/download #. Boot with Nova:: Nova boot --flavor $TRUST_FLAVOR_UUID --image $TRUST_IMG test .. note:: Once finish the deployment, the node will be measured during ``trusted boot`` and save the hash values into TPM[5]_. #. Verify the result via OAT Server: This is outside the scope of Ironic, an OAT Server should be running and configured correctly[6]_. User can verify the result by following the steps in [7]_. .. [3] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trusted_Execution_Technology .. [4] https://sourceforge.net/projects/tboot .. [5] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trusted_Platform_Module .. [6] https://github.com/OpenAttestation/OpenAttestation/wiki/Fedora-oat-2.2-packages-installation .. [7] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Bare-metal-trust

commit_message:
Refresh list of online DHCP agents after reset

Get list of online DHCP agents for 'net04' network after
node reset and re-initialize SSH connection to remote.
Also create RSA key pair using API and copy private key
on node before connecting to instance via SSH.

Change-Id: Ia3d04fc1297c7075473f0c8184ca78d7472af5a7
Partial-bug: #1493228

commit_message:
RPC renames

To follow the changes in networking-bgpvpn of "BGPVPN
connection" into "BGPVPN".

And to cleanup "BGP VPN network" into "BGPVPN".

Depends-On: I1fdf260b98d0d1f71d21cfd02636cf014c81c72c
Change-Id: Iebae9059a9c44dba327efdf9538660575b8708aa

commit_message:
Send gratutious ARPs on ip monitor event also

This commit sends gratuitious ARP requests in case
ip_monitor returns zero exit code. This will allow
for periodical updates of neighbours in case our IP
is OK and neighbour did not receive arps of the node
after ip was initially started.

Change-Id: I6d6134eee08352c1b0f0ef85dc79bfd6ee804378
Closes-bug: #1492210

commit_message:
Send gratutious ARPs on ip monitor event also

This commit sends gratuitious ARP requests in case
ip_monitor returns zero exit code. This will allow
for periodical updates of neighbours in case our IP
is OK and neighbour did not receive arps of the node
after ip was initially started.

Change-Id: I6d6134eee08352c1b0f0ef85dc79bfd6ee804378
Closes-bug: #1492210

commit_message:
Fix the problem with first pacemaker start

Sometimes during first start pacemaker can not connect to corosync via IPC.
The root cause of this is that corosync is run under root user and pacemaker
processes are run under hacluster/haclient user/group. Adding uidgid
with names of pacemaker user/group helps to fix it.

Change-Id: I1c103ec8e67f7af170dc2d548c3b49b5f1234b23
Closes-bug: #1493483
